member.summary: This is a hashed version of the url that is sent to CCP to request the file

member.name: F:libeveapi.ApiResponse.CurrentTime
member.summary: This is the current time that CCP sends to us on the file.

member.name: F:libeveapi.ApiResponse.CachedUntil
member.summary: This is the time that the file says it is cacheable till in CCP time. We use the currentTime that is sent along with the file to calculate how long this is till.

member.name: F:libeveapi.ApiResponse.CurrentTimeLocal
member.summary: This is the current time on the local machine.

member.name: F:libeveapi.ApiResponse.CachedUntilLocal
member.summary: This is what time the file should be cached to according to the local clock. A timespan is created from the eve time, and added to CurrentTimeLocal

member.summary: The raw xml response from the api

member.name: F:libeveapi.ApiResponse.FromCache
member.summary: True if this data came from the cache False if this data came directly from the eve api

member.summary: This parses out all of the elements that are common to each one of the xml files, which mainly includes dates, or errors if they exist.

member.summary: This is the blueprints Productivity Level (TE)

member.summary: This is the blueprints Material Level (ME)

member.summary: Unique Id for this item. This is only guaranteed to be unique within this page load. Ids are recycled over time and it is possible for this to happen. Also, items are not guaranteed to maintain the same itemId over time. When they are repackaged, stacks are split or merged, when they're assembled, and other actions can cause itemIds to change.

member.summary: If true, indicates that this item is a singleton. This means that the item is not packaged.

member.summary: The items contained in this item if any

member.name: T:libeveapi.InventoryFlagType
member.summary: EVE stores items in a location with a value we call the "flag." This value is used to indicate more data about the item's location. For example, instead of having different locations for each of the modules, we instead have the single location (the ship) with many flags. The flags indicate if the item is in cargo or fitted, and if fitted, to which slot.

member.name: T:libeveapi.KillLog.Kill
member.summary: A Kill contains a victim, list of attackers, and items lost

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Kill.KillId
member.summary: Unique kill ID for this kill. This is to be used as the input for beforeKillID if you need to scroll back. This is globally unique and can be used for uniquely identifying a kill to other killboards.

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Kill.SolarSystemId
member.summary: The ID of the solar system this kill occurred in.

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Kill.KillTime
member.summary: What time the event occurred.

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Kill.KillTimeLocal
member.summary: What time the event occurred in local time.

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Kill.MoonId
member.summary: In some situations, this is present to define what moon a kill occurred at. Note that this is generally only present in situations where the loss is a POS structure. It is not guaranteed to be populated.

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Kill.Victim
member.summary: The victim of the attack

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Kill.Attackers
member.summary: The attacking pilots

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Kill.Items
member.summary: The items lost / dropped in the attack

member.name: T:libeveapi.KillLog.Pilot
member.summary: A pilot base class

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Pilot.CharacterId
member.summary: Character's ID. Fairly self-explanatory. Can be 0 in which case this kill was not done by a character and instead was done by a corporation. In the victim case, this implies it is a structure loss.

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Pilot.CharacterName
member.summary: If present, the name of the above characterID.

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Pilot.CorporationId
member.summary: The ID of the corporation. This will always be present, as there is always a corporation behind the victim, whether it is the corporation itself or simply someone in that corporation.

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Pilot.CorporationName
member.summary: The name of the corporation associated with the kill.

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Pilot.AllianceId
member.summary: If not 0, this is the ID of the alliance the corporation belongs to.

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Pilot.AllianceName
member.summary: The name of the alliance associated with the kill.

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Pilot.ShipTypeId
member.summary: The item lost. This could be a ship as suggested by the name but can potentially be anything that generates a kill event.

member.name: T:libeveapi.KillLog.VictimPilot
member.summary: The victim pilot

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.VictimPilot.DamageTaken
member.summary: How much damage the victim took before succumbing to fiery defeat and humiliation. Please note that this damage is calculated after resists. It does give you a decent idea of how much they were tanking, however.

member.name: T:libeveapi.KillLog.Attacker
member.summary: An Attacking pilot

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Attacker.SecurityStatus
member.summary: The security status of the aggressor at the time of this kill.

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Attacker.DamageDone
member.summary: The amount of damage done to the victim. This is post-resists damage done.

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Attacker.FinalBlow
member.summary: Whether or not this aggressor is attributed with the so-called "final blow."

member.name: F:libeveapi.KillLog.Attacker.WeaponTypeId
member.summary: What weapon we decided to show this person as using. Often a weapon, sometimes a ship or missile, rarely a fish

member.summary: True if the destroyed item contained other items.
